text.section: The commanding officer of a garrison, fort, post, camp or other place, brigade, regiment, detached battalion, or other detached command or a superior authority may appoint for that command a special court-martial.
Except for a commissioned officer, a special court-martial may try an individual subject to military law, for any crime or offense made punishable under the military laws of the United States.
